title: Lesson 59
paragraph: More descriptive adjectives — nationality, freshness, helpfulness and size among them.

words.meaning: from or relating to a country that is not one's own
recently made or obtained; new and not stale
words.example: We bought fresh bread from the bakery.

words.japaneseMeaning: 友好的な／親しみやすい
words.example: The staff at the hotel were very friendly.

words.meaning: containing as much as possible; not empty
words.example: The bus was full, so we waited for the next one.

words.meaning: relating to the whole world; worldwide
words.japaneseMeaning: 世界的な／グローバルな
words.example: The company has a global presence in many countries.

words.meaning: weighing a lot; difficult to lift or move
words.example: The package is too heavy to carry alone.
Her advice was very helpful for my project.

words.meaning: having a high temperature; very warm
words.example: Be careful — the soup is hot.

words.meaning: extremely large in size or amount
words.example: They moved into a huge new office.

words.meaning: of great significance or value; essential
words.example: It's important to read the instructions carefully.

words.meaning: not able to occur, exist, or be done
words.example: It seemed impossible to finish on time.
The lecture was interesting and informative.
